text:
Rating: 8.7/10

A thrilling ride with Ethan Hunt and his IMF team taking on a rogue AI.

Highlights
- Engaging Story: Well-balanced pacing with plenty of twists and turns.
- Strong Performances: Tom Cruise shines, with great supporting cast.
- Impressive Action: Masterful direction and breathtaking stunts.

Criticisms
- Predictable Plot: Some viewers may find it predictable at times.
- Underdeveloped Characters: Supporting characters could have more depth.

Verdict
An exhilarating ride appealing to fans of action-packed spy films. Recommended for a thrilling cinematic experience.
The movies are built around death-defying showcases of suspense and bravado that grow increasingly more mind-boggling with each sequel.
Mission: Impossible - Dead Reckoning Part One is an epic, amazing spy thriller with beautifully shot locations, amazing stunts, set pieces, action, and great performances from its amazing cast.

I thought this was just fine. This may be a me issue but I'm finding it more difficult to suspend my disbelief with Tom Cruise as Ethan Hunt.  Combine that with a ramping down of stakes from the previous films where the threat was ultimately 3 nukes, and I think we find ourselves at an impasse.  I still enjoyed the film, but I'm hoping the eighth film is the last.  This needs to end, everyone just looks tired.
Great action and really engaging probably my second favorite of the franchise.

The series drops off a lot with dead reckoning. The whole idea of the entity is ridiculous. They literally handcuff Ethan in this effectively limiting his movements. 3 stars for the jump but not with paying for.
Fun action, good stunts, definitely worth watching

Dead Reckoning takes the easy route for Ethan Hunt’s final threat with an AI bent on destroying humanity using nuclear missiles—a danger that the last James Bond had already offered us. While the film drags at times, with moments that could have easily been trimmed, it still delivers the kind of high-stakes sequences we love in Mission Impossible, such as the train and airport scenes. That said, one can’t help but wonder why Ethan, who has access to face-mask technology that prevents him from being identified, would choose to walk into such a heavily monitored airport without using one. Still, the movie keeps us engaged, and in the end, it’s a thoroughly entertaining ride.

My god what a waste of nearly three hours of my life. With some of the previous movies the action sequences saved the day, but clearly the cupboard was bare this time. Fighting on top of a train?? Really?! May as well have done a sword fight up a staircase, or maybe running in and out of doors like Scooby Doo. And Tom Cruise is starting to look weird, David Hasselhoff weird.
Not bad, but definitely not the best of the mission impossible series. Tom Cruise always puts on a great performance!

I can honestly say this movie is one of the worst I've seen it quite some time. The thought that hundreds of people worked their tails off to produce this dreck is really disappointing — for THEM. The writers, producers (lookin' at you, Tom), and director all share the blame for this. It's almost unwatchable; it's that bad. The chase scene — is there more than one? I'm only half-way through this overlong, nearly 3-hour movie — is pretty good but we've come to expect at least THAT is decent. The acting, particularly on the part of Tom Cruise, is way too internal. If I can't see it on your face, Tom, I can't read your mind through the screen. What I cannot believe is that both critics (whom I usually ignore) and the audience (whom I usually trust) are sucked in by this terrible script, lousy acting (still lookin' at you, Tom), and substandard direction on this self-parodical, over-produced mess of a movie. Hard pass. I'm not sure if I'll even watch the next one if it's more of the same.
I really liked this show! Tom Cruise always gives a great performance!
Amazing movie all around. This had me so excited for the next one after this movie came out. The motorcycle scene and driving were so good in getting your attention.

Tom cruise never ages he is like a vampire along with Brad Pitt. I can not believe Tom Cruise does all of his stunts. They are amazing especially the train scene with Hayley Atwell. I cannot wait until part two come out. Story line is semi-believable. With the advancement of AI.
A great and fun MI movie.Not as good as some of the others, but one of the best in the franchise.

It's worth a watch if you're a fan of the series. Just don't expect your typical mission impossible, in terms of story that is.

I love movies about AI and the potential dangers it brings to mankind, but i also aknowledge that incorporating that into this kind of movie will always be complicated and difficult. For that reason, the script here didn't do a great job.

It had some cool scenes, but it wasn't enough for me. 

I'm still giving it a positive review, but this is not the best mission impossible had to offer.

I can’t understand the rating given on here for this movie. While I’m usually in for a far fetched romp this far fetched tale riding on the rise of AI is very hard to follow and understand. The Action is mediocre for the whole save the world genre. The dialog is the most unrealistic I’ve heard out side of children’s cartoons. If I hadn’t had a house full of guests invited to watch I would have save 3 hrs of my life for something more productive.

for those we never meet
remember that the oath is not the path
but the path is the oath
And to deceive the lord of the flies
kill the lord of lies
I liked this movie! It was not the best of all the Mission Impossible movies but it was good!
Nice and very well written ! Good balance
